title: Double slit - angle of 1st-order bright fringe

content.question: Monochromatic light of wavelength <math alttext="lambda" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math> is incident upon two parallel, narrow slits that are a distance <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> apart, as shown in the figure. A screen is located a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from the slits, where <math alttext="D is much greater than s" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi><mo>≫</mo><mi>s</mi></math>, and an interference pattern forms on the screen as indicated. The angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> in the figure is the angle between one leg and the hypotenuse of the right triangle shown. A leg and the hypotenuse of the triangle connect the midpoint of the two slits to the centers of the central bright maximum and the adjacent bright maximum in the interference pattern. If <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> is small, what is an approximate expression for <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction s over D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>s</mi><mi>D</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the fraction lambda over s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>λ</mi><mi>s</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction lambda over s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>λ</mi><mi>s</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
